event.name: 4th of July Party
foodTips: Outdoor grilling is expected - plan for burgers, hot dogs, and BBQ.
Hot weather means lighter appetites - reduce food quantities by 10-15%.
Keep cold foods cold - refresh ice every 90 minutes in summer heat.
Fireworks timing matters - have lighter snacks for after dark.
Patriotic presentation adds to the fun - use themed plates and decorations.
event.foodBuyingGuide: 4th of July is about grilled meats and outdoor eating. Plan 1 burger/hot dog + 1 side per person, or 6oz pulled pork with buns. Keep everything fresh with plenty of ice. Watermelon and cold sides are essential in summer heat.
proTips: Outdoor heat increases beer consumption by 25% - have more than you think.
Ice melts FAST in July - buy 5lbs per person and have backup bags.
Coolers in shade last 40% longer than those in sun.
Red, white, and blue cocktails are a fun addition to the bar.
People drink less after sunset when fireworks start - front-load your ice.
event.buyingGuide: This is a daytime outdoor beer event. Stock heavily on light, refreshing beers and have plenty of ice. Mixed drinks with vodka and lemonade or margaritas are popular. Plan 5-6 drinks per person for a 5-hour party.

meta.title: How Much Pizza for 200 Guests 4th of July Party? | 49 pizzas
meta.description: Need pizza for a 200-person 4th of july party? You'll need exactly 49 pizzas. Free calculator with pro tips for party planning.
meta.h1: How Much Pizza for a 200 Guests 4th of July Party?

mathExplanation.label: Estimate actual eaters
mathExplanation.explanation: At xlarge events, about 80% of guests will eat full servings.

mathExplanation.label: Calculate servings (as main dish)
mathExplanation.explanation: As a main dish, plan for 3 pizzas per person.

mathExplanation.label: Apply 4th of july party modifier
mathExplanation.explanation: 4th of July Partys typically consume 30% less pizza than average.

mathExplanation.label: Add 15% buffer & round up
mathExplanation.explanation: Always round up and add a buffer. Running out of food is worse than having leftovers!
